intro: Galium verum f. trichanthum, commonly known as yellow bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial with slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. The leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. This variety is distinguished by its trichanthous (three-angled) stems, which give it its specific epithet.
